p: C-methylated flavonoid is the characteristic group of the compound in S. nervosum with the dominant occurrence of DMC ( 38). Unlike common flavonoids, C-methylated derivatives possess one or two methyl groups directly linked with the aromatic ring ( 34– 41, 51– 65). Besides that, ubiquitous flavonoids and their glycosides were also identified, such as kaempferol ( 42), quercetin ( 43), tamarixetin ( 44), myricetin derivatives, and their glycosides ( 45– 47) ( Figure 2).
